subject: Politics
title: How Campaigns Work
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Campaigns Work.

hook.text: Modern campaigns are war rooms: data scientists, pollsters, ad makers, and fundraisers all working the vote.

buildup.text: Campaigns identify supporters, persuade undecided voters, and mobilize their base to show up on election day.

discovery.text: Obama's 2008 campaign revolutionized data use. Micro-targeting let teams tailor messages to individual voters.

twist.text: Campaigns run on emotion, not policy. Fear, hope, and anger move voters more than 50-page position papers.

climax.text: The best campaigns win the narrative. Whoever defines what the election is 'about' usually wins it.

punchline.text: Campaigns sell stories, not policies. The best story wins the vote.

quiz.question: What did Obama's 2008 campaign pioneer?
options: Television advertising for the first time
